title.text: Generating Indirect Answers to Yes-No Questions

entities.text: Generating Indirect Answers to Yes-No Questions

abstractContent.text: a Yes-No question conversationally implicates the speaker's evaluation of the truth of the questioned proposition.
We present the approach to generation used in our implemented system for generating and interpret~ing indirect answers to Yes-No questions in English.

entities.text: interpret~ing indirect answers to Yes-No questions in English

abstractContent.text: Generation of a discourse plan is performed in two phases: content planning and plan pruning.
During content planning, stimulus conditions are used to trigger speaker goals to include appropriate extra information with the direct answer.
Plan pruning determines what parts of this full response do not need to be stated explicitly-resulting in, inappropriate discourse contexts, the generation of an indirect answer.
